Reviews.Title: “Service Par Excellence”
Reviews.Author: Katlowry
Reviews.Content: Hotel Manager Michele Constantini puts a great amount of credence in the belief that, "Our guests' stay begins long before their physical arrival". This belief is not only adhered to with the staff, it is their mainstay of operations. From the beginning of my encounter with the Palazzo Vitturi, I was contacted by the hotel staff. Not only were they friendly and courteous, they wanted to help me save money and make my travel experience carefree and fluid. I had originally booked with a booking engine and the reservation staff from the hotel contacted me in order to help me save money and assist my group with discounted private transfers. They responded to every email and query timely and efficiently and if they didn't know the answer to one of my question, they would find out the answer and contact me immediately. Overall my experience with the staff was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, perfect service”
Reviews.Author: Dale S
Reviews.Content: This location is perfect for Venice: 5 min from Piazzo S Marco and from Rialto. The Campo S Maria Formosa is one of the most atmospheric squares in Venice. Our room was spacious beyond compare (I've visited Venice 8 or 10 times only to be squashed previously into a rabbit hutch!); it was clean and the staff really friendly and helpful. One is within easy walking distance of authentic restaurants off the tourist track in the Castello. After our stay, we realised we'd forgotten a few belongings, and the hotel staff could not have been more helpful or friendly in returning these. In 50 years of visiting Venice, the Palazzo Vitturi has to be number one for good value and an all-round outstanding experience.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Leika44
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel was lovely and we will definitely be staying here again. Set in a lovely square facing a beautiful church and just a short walk to the main tourist sights and the vaporetto stop. All the little streets leading off the square are full of interesting shops and restaurants. The hotel really is a converted palace and the period features have been restored and maintained beautifully. Some of the rooms are modern and some, like the one we stayed in, are more traditional. Our room was very large and spotlessly clean with balconies overlooking the square. The bed was comfortable and the bathroom was good. The breakfast buffet is simple but ample and good quality. It does not matter that there is no restaurant because the surrounding streets are full of lovely places to eat. The square is lively in the day and quiet and night. Only note of caution is that the walk from the vaporetto stop includes several bridges so you need to be able to get your luggage up and down the steps. The water taxi goes closer to the hotel but is expensive. It was a joy to wake up in our lovely room every morning and a pleasure to return to it at the end of each day. This hotel is lovely and we are already planning our next stay..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: HammerGazzar
Reviews.Content: Interior of hotel looked beautiful. We were upgraded from superior room to junior suite on arrival. Room was huge and even had it's own 16th century frieze on the ceiling. Quiet at night which was good. Staff at reception were very helpful and knowledgeable. Hotel is in a great spot close to St Marks (5 minute walk) but away from the big crowds. Minor moan about an unpredictable shower but otherwise this was a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: marlene_london
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely hotel in a brilliant location. Close to the main tourist spots, not far from the main Venice bus terminal with lots of wonderful shops and restaurants around. The reception area is bright and welcoming and the reception staff were all very friendly, welcoming and helpful. They spoke English which made it even easier to get directions and advise on where to eat. Our room was large, decorated beautifully and very clean. Our bathroom was also large and spotlessly clean. This is a very old, traditional Venician building and they have done a great job of providing modern and clean rooms but keeping the traditional feel to them. The main corridors are old, traditional and beautiful. My only little criticism would be the breakfast. It is continental style with a small selection of cheese, meat, rolls, cake etc. but it was a bit limited and could do with a bit more variety. Above all, a toaster would be great so that guests can make toast for their breakfast. Also be aware that the stairs in this hotel can be steep. There didn't appear to be a lift but there was stair lift for people with mobility problems. Would I stay here again - definitely. I would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and service”
Reviews.Author: Mench L
Reviews.Content: This place is less than ten minutes walk to San Marco and Rialto which we really liked. It's close but far away enough from the crowd. It's surrounded with lots of restaurants, bakery, ATMs and stores. It's very easy to walk back just to drop off some stuff that you don't want to carry around, or to use the bathroom if you don't like using public restrooms, or to just take a short rest. There are water taxi and gondolas waiting across the square. The staff are very friendly, helpful and accommodating. Always smiling. I love the daily breakfast. I miss my daily cappuccino! The hotel is a converted palace facing a beautiful church in a small and quaint square. The rooms are spacious with a big bathroom. The ceiling is more than 15 feet high. The hardwood floor is very clean and each room is equipped with a thermostat for heating and A/C. The entire hotel and room smelled good every day. It also has a free wifi. Downside: No public computers and no elevator.

Reviews.Title: “Could not recommend highly enough”
Reviews.Author: Que C
Reviews.Content: This hotel ticked every box. It was my wifes birthday treat and we were made to feel very special and welcome with a bottle of prosecco on ice for when we arrived - ahhhh delicious!!For service these guys get 10/10. They just did all the little things that make a stay perfect, always there to help with anything but leaving you alone to relax - Clean, friendly and very quiet - just what the doctor ordered. The room we stayed in was stunning (very grand tour)....what can I say, it was just Venice and made perfect by the little extra attention to service detail. Highly recommend! They only do breakfast and dont really have a restaurant per se hence the average/good ratings - but it was excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, spacious, beckoning to come back”
Reviews.Author: Ruediger K
Reviews.Content: This hotel is indeed a great value. On a lively, wide plaza, within walking distance to many important venues and buildings, except to get there from the Vaporetto stop you have to walk across four bridges, which is somewhat tough with suitcases. Our room with a balcony facing the square was superb, spacious, pleasantly, though not richly furnished. Michele at the front desk was very helpful with tips how to get to places. The breakfast was good. We can recommend this hotel with pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's stay - two families with four kids”
Reviews.Author: Tyukha
Reviews.Content: The hotel is truly great, the staff were very friendly to us and even to our shouting and fighting little angels. The location is great, with a big square in front and a wonderful second hand shop and little canals close to the hotel. I would really, really recommend it! Great value for money, too. The pillows are somewhat hard to sleep on.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful staff and service”
Reviews.Author: gracie1606
Reviews.Content: This very pleasant hotel in Venice made for a comfortable stay during our recent visit. We stayed a total of four nights. The staff were helpful and sincere, some of the best service I've experienced. This hotel is very close to both Rialto and St Mark's Square. The staff were able to recommend a couple of very good restaurants. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a quieter location with good facilities and great service.

Reviews.Title: “A very good choice to enjoy Venice!”
Reviews.Author: lighttravellers
Reviews.Content: I was very pleasantly surprised by Palazzo Vitturi. It's a beautifully-located, 13th century palazzo with large, spacious rooms and wide corridors with elegant furniture and upholstery. The room my husband and I stayed in (room 11) was very clean and the bathroom quite modern and spacious. Our room was facing the piazza so we had a beautiful view to enjoy. Staff was always very polite and ready to help too. Definitely a very good choice to explore Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and spacious hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in September this year, and I can highly recommend it. It is well positioned in a lovely piazza away from the hustle and bustle of Venice but a few minutes walk to the centre. We stayed in the junior suite which was so lovely and spacious, and Venetian style. The best part of our stay was the service the hotel offered us. They were so obliging and anything we wanted they organized for us. Michele at the front desk was absolutely fantastic, a truly wonderful person willing to help in any way. I thoroughly recommend this hotel in every way, Service, rooms, breakfast, can,t fault it. Thankyou for making our stay in Venice enjoyable Michele!

Reviews.Title: “OCTOBER 2011”
Reviews.Author: Steve B
Reviews.Content: We found this to be an excellent hotel in a really good location. Staff were always very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: PailinSP
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Pallazo Vitturi for 3 nights in October, 2 adults and 2 children. The hotel is located on a quiet square, near Piazza San Marco (8 min. walk) and the Rialto Bridge (8 min. walk) , and you can walk to all major sights. Our room is in the second floor and are very spacious and very clean, the beds were very comfortable (2 single beds for the children), free Wi-Fi internet in the room , the TV is 20â€™ LCD (small for the room) and the room is just a bit dark (at the back side). There is no elevator, but they do have a wheelchair and luggage lift (they'll take your luggage up and down). They have a good breakfast room with a decent continental breakfast. Price: 280â‚¬/day. Restaurants we went: Osteria al Portego (very good) and Ristorante Marco Polo (good). Gelato : La Boutique del Gelato (very good). All near the Hotel (Salizada San Lio). Really a good place to stay and rest after walking and exploring the beautiful Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Palazzo Vitturi”
Reviews.Author: Paul P
Reviews.Content: Palazzo Vitturi The old chronicles its glory and majesty infested us The gallant house sleeped in history is breathing the old nobility The spirit of the Lagune the air so balmy is breezing us How complacent to dwell in this comfortableness Dr. Gerda and Paul Pagel from WÃ¼rzburg, Germany with many thanks to all at Hotel Palazzo Vitturi

Reviews.Title: “The hotel fits Venice like a glove”
Reviews.Author: ChantalH
Reviews.Content: I have never been to a hotel where the staff was so friendly and helpfull. The rooms are not small and not too modern. Too modern wouldn't fit the venue. One litle minor is the breakfast, there is some room for improvement and the coffee at breakfast is awful. But I'm personally very difficult when it comes to my morning coffee. The staff knows you're roomnumber by heart, when you enter for the 2nd time, which gives a nice feeling. They take the time to answer and listen. 2 thumbs up.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: dedoti
Reviews.Content: We visited Italy for a week in September 2011 and stayed in four different cities in similarly-priced hotels. Hotel Palazzo Vitturi was the best of all and truly exceeded our expectatons. The hotel is located on a relatively quiet square, but very close to all major sights. The staff was gerat and very helpful. The room was very clean and had everything we needed. Great breakfast in the morning, free internet, safe deposit box, million TV channels if you ever need them. Perfect for a traveler who does not spend much time in the hotel, but does not compromise on cleanliness and service.

Reviews.Title: “It was incredible”
Reviews.Author: doris u
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel, beautiful, clean, perfect location. Staff is amazingly friendly and helpful. Rooms are spacious and wonderful. Couldn't be better, can't wait to go back. Washington, DC

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, first class staff”
Reviews.Author: DesNichols
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and from the moment we arrived the small band of staff were unbelievably helpful and welcoming. The rooms are relatively basic but the location is just perfect - a canal bridge away from the hustle and bustle but surrounded by the most beautiful sights. I really recommend it as long as you do not want 5 star facilities (and the costs that go with it)

Reviews.Title: “An outsatnding hotel”
Reviews.Author: 221sgreen
Reviews.Content: We all loved this hotel. It was in an extremely beautiful 13th century palazzo in Venice and situated in a lovely square , ideally located between Rialto and St Mark's. Our room was very comfortable and had a wonderful frescoed ceiling. The whole hotel was immaculate and very stylish. The breakfast was plentiful and delicious and efficiently managed each day. The hotel manager and Michele were charming, extremely attentive, helpful and professional. We were given a room upgrade and the hotel staff were very accommodating about arranging an extra nightâ€™s stay in the same room at late notice. I couldn't fault the hotel. It was superb and can be recommended without any reservation whatsoever!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stevesquared
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent smaller hotel located near St Mark's Square. Stayed only one night in a superior double. Room was very spacious and well appointed. Bed was firm and comfortable. Bathroom was really nice with Europe's best shower! We would stay here again. There is no elevator, but they do have a wheelchair and luggage lift. If a room with a view is important to you then request upon booking.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in prime Venice with of plenty space.”
Reviews.Author: trejam
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a family of 8 with 5 children and were really impressed with the spaciousness of the rooms. The beds were very comfortable, the bathroom is five-star and of course free WIFI at hi-speed. The continental breakfast had a decent selection and good coffee. Enjoy dinner on the square and relax while the kids play & run after long days in the narrow alleys of Vencie.

Reviews.Title: “Great bedrooms!”
Reviews.Author: Lacerda_2
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed two nights in this hotel. We`ve got surprised when we entered our room because it was really big! The bed was comfortable, the bathroom was new and very clean. We liked it a lot. The service was very good. We had an early flight, so we asked about the possibility of having breakfast very early in the mornig and they prepared it for us. It was really kind of them. It is located in front of a square and about 5 minutes walking to Piazza San Marco or Rialto Bridge. If we come back to Venice, we will try to stay in Palazzo Vitturi again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, gorgeous room - steep stairs and no lift!”
Reviews.Author: PossumIrish
Reviews.Content: A boutique little hotel within short walking distance of both Rialto Bridge and St Marks areas. Our room was huge (we were upgraded because of my birthday!) and the ceiling in typical Venetian design. Great bathroom, great massive bed. Breakfast is very simple - pastries, juice, ham, cheese and coffee (will make cappuccino when asked) but this is typical of Italian hotels and it is lovely. Little quirks like having no spare pillows in hotel and being not allowed to use computer to print airline tickets let it don a little bit. However, hotel is in a cute little square, so not too noisy so good nights sleep is guaranteed. DONT miss the little corner pizza makers opposite the hotel just over the bridge - best pizza EVER!

Reviews.Title: “A delightful hotel”
Reviews.Author: channing100
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in the summer of 2010 for 2 nights - I can highly recommend it as a lovely place to stay in a beautiful square that is within easy walking distance of the main attractions of Venice. The staff were very kind and helpful, the rooms were very spacious, clean and comfortable - it was a treat to stay in such a historic building that had had tasteful, stylish modern features incorporated into it. I'd happily return to this hotel if I ever visit Venice again - it was one of the delights of my trip there, not just a place to sleep!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Indra_and_Wim
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 2 nights. It was a huge room with 2 double beds. The bathroom had a rainshower and bubble bath and was very modern. The room was very clean. The neigbours upstairs where a little bit noisy and because of the wooden ceiling we could here every step they took, but I wouldn't expect anything different from a 14th century palace! We had a fantastic view over the square but at night time (saturday night) it was noisy outside, a lot of groups passed by while we where trying to sleep. Breakfast was good for Italian standards: fresh rolls,croissants, cheese, cornflakes... (in Rome we got only old rolls and marmelade!) Staff was very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Raquelita_BCN
Reviews.Content: The room was quite old and not cosy. we were expecting more, having read all the review. the breakfast was not enough and the service not exceptional. the location was great in a quiet area

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel In A Great Location”
Reviews.Author: carrigman
Reviews.Content: I went to Venice on a solo trip to do photography from 2nd November to 6th November and I chose the Palazzo Vitturi based on the reviews on Tripadvisor and for its ideal location. I had initially chosen a hotel in Mestre based on price but I'm glad I changed my mind and stayed in the city itself. Yes, you pay a bit extra in comparison to the mainland but it's well worth it for the freedom to explore that being city-based affords. I arrived at the hotel around 7pm and as soon as I entered the small lobby the very pleasant and helpful young lady in reception greeted me by name. Clearly, I was the only solo guest expected that evening but even so it was a very nice touch. My double room was on the first floor and I was amazed at how spacious it was. It was furnished in a contemporary style (see photos) and was spotlessly clean. The bed was very comfortable and, of course, this being Venice, there was no traffic noise to interrupt my night's sleep. Breakfast was the typical Continental self service fare of fruit juices, fruits, yoghurts, cereals, breads etc. Which suited me just fine as I am not one for the typical UK/Irish hot breakfasts. There is a 24 hours presence on the front desk which I found very useful as I typically left the hotel around 5:45am to take photographs around the St Marks Square area and then returned in time for breakfast at 8am. All in all, an excellent little hotel in a great location and if I ever return to Venice I shall certainly stay here again. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, clean rooms”
Reviews.Author: jean481
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a wonderful place to stay if you don't mind walking! It's 7 minutes from Rialto, 10 minutes from St. Marcos, and 5 minutes from the Vaporetto. I read an earlier review that the coffee was undrinkable and I would beg to differ! Perhaps it's changed, but I found the coffee to be fantastic! The staff was wonderful and so accomodating! My only concern was that I paid considerably more than the advertised rate, but I needed the location and it was the high season. However, the price I was quoted rose by E 100. for the weekend nights, but never dropped back down after Sunday. I was disappointed because everything else about Palazzo Vitturi was perfect! Also, definitely avoid the restaurant diagonally across the square, the food was horrible and they will try to cheat you on your tab. I had to send my check back twice before it was correct. (I hate being taken advantage of, and this seems to be a Venetian tendancy)

Reviews.Title: “Il migliore”
Reviews.Author: Gattommaso
Reviews.Content: Every time I travel to Venice I try to stay in Campo Santa Maria Formosa due to its ideal location. I have stayed at ALL the hotels on Campo S.M. Formosa and its immediate surroundings over the past years. Stayed here in June with my son.This was the first time at Palazzo Vitturi and by far the best hotel, for price, room, and service. Staff is excellent ! Being Italian I would recommend with pride this Hotel to anyone seeking a pleasant stay in the Serenissima ! Saluti allo Staff Tommaso e Andrea

Reviews.Title: “A SPECIAL GEM IN VENICE - PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: janpalmer
Reviews.Content: This was my second visit to Palazzo Vitturi - visited in 2009, chosen on the strength of the excellent reviews - and just had to return this year so the rest of my family could enjoy the experience! The location is ideally situated between the Rialto and San Marco - so you are truly staying in the heart of the city, but it is so quiet when you wake! To view the square below from one of the balconies is an experience in itself -the Venetians starting their working day, tourists enjoying the evening, or the local cat stalking the pigeons! The service is exemplary, there is a relaxed atmosphere and nothing is too much trouble. It all comes with a smile too! I would not stay anywhere else in Venice, and hope to return in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Spacious Rooms, Very Clean, and Good Location.”
Reviews.Author: Loves2Travell
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a great price for the value. We stayed there for two nights. The rooms were very clean and spacious. The bathroom was very big and also very clean. The hotel is a little difficult to find so make sure you have a map of Venice with you when you get off of the ferry! The location of the hotel is good you have to take about a ten minute walk to get to the major sights.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful”
Reviews.Author: Mickoj
Reviews.Content: We booked through a website late rooms.com and were unable to fly due to the volcanic ash problem which groundwd Europe for a week. We contacted the hotel by email to cancel 48 hours in advance, but they would not refund or accept the cancellation as we had not booked directly through the hotel. Even if they were gracious enough to give a credit note it would have been quite acceptable to us. It confirms all we have heard about rip off Venice without even getting the chance to arrive there.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: NIrelandrosie
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to all the previous reviews. Staff were fabulous, so friendly & helpful & the location is perfect. We took a tip from a previous reviewer who advised splashing out on a water taxi - it was well worth it, not to end up grumpily wandering around trying to find the hotel in the dark. If you are traveling to Venice this is the hotel to head for.

Reviews.Title: “Delightfull little hotel”
Reviews.Author: sunshinelb
Reviews.Content: The Palazzo Vitturi is in Campo Santa Maria Formosa square and it is a very short walk away from Rialto bridge. Easy walk to Piazza San Marco (10 mins). The hotel is small (around 10 rooms). The rooms were large with plenty of space and a very large bathroom. Breakfast was ok, enough to keep us going till lunch time. The staff very friendly and helpfull with all our requests. There is a steep stair case to go up to the rooms but the staff carried our suitcases up and thus no worries. The hotel is an excellent choice for Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: GLiv
Reviews.Content: Pefect location between Rialto and P. San Marco, overlooking a large piazza with a church. Close to everything yet quiet, less touristy and more of a local feel. Beautifully renovated. Sofiane, the Manager, is a wealth of information that he shares with enthusiasm, and the staff very helpful. The rooms are either modern or feel like a real palace. Bathrooms are modern. We were really happy to find it, and will go back. G&L

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: i-gots-wanderlust
Reviews.Content: This is a lovely little hotel! The front desk staff is friendly and helpful and the rooms are comfortable, clean, and BIG (especially the bathroom). This is a great base for exploring Venice. Located in the quiet Campo Santa Maria Formosa, it's an easy walk to Ponte Rialto & the Grande Canal and Piazza San Marco. There is a restaurant in the square as well as a small bakery. Word of advice: splurge on a taxi when you arrive in Venice and ask the driver to take you to Campo Santa Maria Formosa. Venetian "streets" aren't easy to navigate, especially if it's your first time and it's easy to get lost (not to mention all the steps!) and it's a drag with luggage. You'll get a nice mini-tour of the canals without the hassle of dragging your bags up and over bridges and steps.

Reviews.Title: “What a wonderful hotel in a lovely location and excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: Pupa29
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay here. This was a treat for my 30th birthday and I could not have asked for more. The staff were all so helpful especially Amza who even organised us a day at the beach in Lido! We upgraded to the suite which was lovely! The living room was huge with high ceilings (nicely painted), it had 2 balcony's overlooking a pretty square and the bedroom was great with a large bed! This hotel is perfectly situated within a 10 minute walk to Rialto bridge and to San Marco yet it is away from the rush of tourists. We were recommended places to go and they booked us a Gondola ride and even organised a bottle of prosecco for us as well! :) We would recommend this hotel to anyone and will definitely come back next time we go to Venice. Thanks to all for making our stay special, Mr & Mrs Rudge

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Staff and lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: WashDCBlizzard
Reviews.Content: I was just reading the reviews and remembering my 2007 trip to Venice. We had a hard time finding the hotel when we arrived. We called and whoever was on duty asked us to describe our location AND he came and found us and lead us back to the hotel. You cannot beat that as service. We throughly enjoyed our stay in this quiet little haven. I highly recommend this hotel.. the rooms are huge and comfortable. The staff was terrific.. you could not ask for more.

Reviews.Title: “very clean hotel with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: cpedwards33
Reviews.Content: very clean hotel with friendly staff. Room a good size with a very large bed. Breakfast continental with plenty to eat and some variety.

Reviews.Title: “A safe haven in Venice”
Reviews.Author: MysticKid
Reviews.Content: We decided to swing by Venice for a 2 day/1 night visit while we were in northern Italy and it was a fairly good visit. We had our two teenaged kids with us and let them know we were going out of the way to a very special city where there is really nothing like it in the world. Well... true to an extent. Massive traffic jam getting to parking gargage, completely overrun by tourists in July and mean Englishmen w/ a couple of incidents. The boat ride coming in was actually a fun one and it showed the breadth of the canals structure for what Venice is known. The stop was a somewhat confusing 10 minute walk to the hotel but the it was an oasis next to the rest of Venice. The man checking us in could not have been nicer or more informative. He helped w/ a great non-tourist restaurant and an explanation on how to get around, while chiding us that we were Japanese tourists only staying 1 night. The room was not on the front square (we had reserved a room vtoo near our stay) and it was a huge room w/ a massive King bed and a pullout couch. We negotiated sleeping arrangements and my daughter ended up on the pullout couch which collapsed due to the frailty of the mattress/support. We laughed and fixed it up as good as possible as there were no other rooms left in the hotel. It turned out fine when we realized the wood supports were simply out of place. Bathroom was big and very clean, the area was quiet as we were on an alley and we loved the old, quaint nature of the hotel. We loved coming back throughout the day on the square in front of the hotel that had nice little cafes, a small market, a beautiful church and good access to the toursist areas... while being a little quietly removed. Internet did not work up in the rooms and was a bit bizarre in a room located in back of the small lobby. Breakfast in the morning was VERY good w/ fresh fruit and delicious coffee. Really like the young man at the lobby who made our stay very special. I would go back to the hotel but frankly, would not make Venice a high priortity when we travel back next time to Italy.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Accommodations!!!”
Reviews.Author: zeitfam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in early October 2008. From the moment we walked in we felt welcome. Sofiane Lahouasnia and his staff were incredibly friendly and helpful. The hotel is absolutely beautiful and full of warmth and charm. The accommodations are excellent and immaculate. We found the location to be ideal. We would recommend the Hotel Palazzo Vitturi to everyone traveling to Venice. We can't wait to return! Thank you!!!! Sofiane and Staff

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ian-on-hols
Reviews.Content: Spacious room for a standard double. Clean and well kept hotel. Good continental breakfast. Staff very friendly and extremely helpful. Great location- 5 to10 mins from either Rialto or St Marks. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Peter Giorgis”
Reviews.Author: Peter_12325
Reviews.Content: This would have to be one of the nicest hotels i have stayed in Italy. We were greeted by Sofian, who spoke fluent English, and he was just amazing. The rooms are fantastic and i dont think there is a bad room in the place. I cant sing this hotels praises enough. Sofian, on the first afternoon booked a Gondola ride (at reduced prices) which was absolutely amazing, and also organised a free water taxi to take us to the island of Murano. I will definately recommend this hotel to anyone who is travelling to Venice, as it is just a few minutes walk from St Marks Square and overlooks one of the most beautiful squares as well. The beds and rooms are excellent and a very good size. I cant really fault this place. It was an absolute pleasure to stay here, (i dont work for this place, but i was just really pleased with the excellent service, compared to what i experienced in Rome). I will definately go back, and i will only stay at this place as it is reasonably priced compared to the other places, and the hotel staff are very good at answering questions, of what to do and where to go and eat that wont break the budget. Thankyou for making my hotel stay very special.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet, Friendly, Clean.”
Reviews.Author: MadforitalyPretoria
Reviews.Content: A gem in the best area at reasonable rates. The hotel is Airconditioned, double-glazed and clean. Staff are always available to be of assistance with a smile and good advice. Large rooms with a freshness which belies the age of the building. Will return if ever in Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Second Visit”
Reviews.Author: NorthamptonMerlin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with friends again this year and our second visit was just as good as our first. Our room was very grand and spacious, with 2 balconies overlooking the square, a fantastic painted ceiling and terrazzo floor. The bed was super-king size and very comfortable, the ensuite has a shower. Breakfast is also good and served in the large lobby at the top of the stairs, just a few steps from our room - very useful if you want to take your breakfast back to bed! Our friends stayed in the room opposite, also with 2 balconies and just as grand. The staff are helpful, friendly, knowledgeable and speak excellent English. The hotel is clean and the rooms are cleaned properly every day with fresh towels supplied. The square is very pretty and has everything that you would wish for - pretty church, water fountain, bar, fresh fruit stall and plenty of activity during the day but lovely and quiet at night. The hotel is minutes from St Marks Square provided you don't get lost in the narrow streets! We would definitely stay there again, for Venice the price is reasonable and they have a range of rooms with different tarifs.

Reviews.Title: “our favourite hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: BedfordJones
Reviews.Content: We visit Venice twice a year and have always stayed at Hotel Palazzo Vitturi because we know it is always going to be good. Moderately priced for Venice with standard and superior rooms, the latter with balcony views overlooking one of the largest and prettiest squares - Campo S. Maria Formosa. The square is ideally situated for a short walk to Rialto, San Marco or the Fondamente Nuove. Advise a late night stroll around St. Mark's Square to hear the orchestras and midnight chimes of the campanille - never to be forgotten and very romantic. We have stayed at the hotel 5 times now, experiencing most rooms of the hotel.The staff are always very friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The rooms are on the piano noble, the most spacious floor of the old palace and are very comfortable, featuring cool marble floors, original frescoes, huge beds and air conditioning. The square is peaceful by night and bustling by day. We love it and are sure that you will too.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful break”
Reviews.Author: BristolDaisyMay
Reviews.Content: We booked this unseen through Easyjet.com last October. We thought it looked lovely and it was! The staff were all very friendly and helpful. Breakfast was plentiful and European. We walked everywhere (apart from when we were on a boat of some description). Five minutes from St Mark's, 5 minutes or so from the Rialto, good trattorias very close by. We absolutely loved it and so did our friends who were with us and would certainly return again. Thank you Sofiane, Abdul and all the rest of the staff. You are doing a great job! We had the yellow room in two of the photos in the official hotel brochure. We are in our mid 50's and so the quiet square that this hotel is situated on was perfect. An unforgettable break. Go and stay there!

Reviews.Title: “We'll happily return to Palazzo Vitturi”
Reviews.Author: peterposh
Reviews.Content: The hotel is superbly located to the major sites but is in a quiet square. The building has such character and history and yet is equipped with modern facilities. The service was very friendly. The cost was very reasonable. Continental breakfast gets boring but that's my problem. The hotel provided adequate quantity of decent quality

Reviews.Title: “Best Budget Hotel in Venice”
Reviews.Author: hgrieve
Reviews.Content: I've been to Venice many times and this is the best, budget/ave priced hotel I've found in the city. The location is perfect, the building is beautiful; the Venetian gothic palazzo having been sympathetically restored and refurbished, with what must be THE most reserved decor in Venice. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful, but the best thing about this place are the rooms. I live in London and believe me you could fit my one bedroom, central London matchbox in the room we had. Infact, you could probably fit my bedroom on the bed; our room had the biggest bed we'd ever seen! If you've ever been to Venice, you'll know how small the bedrooms usually are, even in the best hotels. The decor was tasteful, the ceiling had the remains of an original fresco and the bathroom was a good size with sleek designer fittings. The whole place was also spotlessly clean. Can't recommend this hotel highly enough; I'll definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “A superb small hotel”
Reviews.Author: primroseCardiff
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in mid November. It is situated in a square that is half way between St Marks and the Rialto Bridge. The room we had was spacious, well appointed and clean. The staff were very friendly and always helpful. The breakfast was not as comprehensive as in some hotels I have stayed in Italy but there was a reasonable selection and plenty of it. I was concerned about finding the hotel as on the map it looks as though it is in a maze of streets but if you get off the waterbus at St Marks and follow the signs to the Rialto you pass through the square where the hotel is situated. However there is only a small brass plaque on the wall to identify the hotel so make sure you memorise the photos of the hotel's exterior on this website. We found the food in Venice variable in quality but were recommended a restaurant, Stephanoâ€™s, which you will pass on the way from St Marks. The food was reasonably priced, good quality and well prepared. They gave us aperitifs and a nightcap, however, not all the diners received nightcaps, I don't know why, we did try to converse in Italian with them so perhaps that made a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Dishonest manager”
Reviews.Author: europeholiday
Reviews.Content: We booked to stay at the Pallazzo Vitturi hotel for two days in September on our Europe holiday.Unfortunately i got quite ill at Cannes and could not make the drive to Venice. We rang the hotel 6 days prior to our booking but the manager informed us that we were past the cancellation time therefore would be charged one night. We decided we would cancel the booking and the manager would try to book the room and we would not get charged and if not booked we would try to make it to Venice. The day before our booking i rang to see if room was booked and told no availability, i also rang at 8pm the checkin night and told no availability. The next day the manager told us the room had not been booked and we were to be charged. It was quite sad because we had looked forward to Venice and the reviews for hotel were good all i can say is the manager is a dishonest toss.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: BrynEngland
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully located - in a large open square (rather than up some grubby alley!) and 10/15 minutes from St Mark's and the Rialto Bridge. Being off the main tourist route means the square is busy but not overcrowded. The staff were friendly and welcoming. We had a superior room which was excellent - spacious and with good but quiet air-con. Breakfast adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel and Staff”
Reviews.Author: Chrisandnanine
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel in early June and loved both the room, with the frescoes, as well as the friendly staff. The view was beautiful, and the room was comfortable. The price was less then I expected to pay, after checking out many of the other hotels online. The first day, I did get lost on my way to the hotel, after wandering for an hour, but that's to be expected in Venice. I called the hotel, they gave me directions, and I was there in 5 minutes, . The staff was helpful in booking things like a gondola ride, and recommending restaurants. My only regret is that I wanted to stay an extra day, but couldn't because they were already booked because of a conference that was starting that day. I would go back and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: moroc2007
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a perfect location on Veneto. A 5 minute walk from St Marco and easy to find between the 2 banks on Campo Santa Maria Formosa. The hotel itself has clean tastefully decorated and larger than normal rooms for Italy. The staff are unbelievably helpful and will help you book anything from restaurants to gondolas. The only downside would be the continental breakfast which like most hotels is average and quite uninteresting. For a budget hotel there are no downsides to booking a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this holel”
Reviews.Author: rustman
Reviews.Content: This hotel is hard to find but they forwarded very clear directions and eventually we found our little slice of heaven. We booked a suite and were blown away by the size of the rooms and the 2 little balconies overlooking the square. Nothing was too much trouble for anything we needed at the hotel - including quirky little bars and eateries. Absolutely no complaints about anything to do with this boutique hotel. We would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody - just loved the experience.
